title: Cough Medicines vs. Honey and Lemon: What Helps a Cough?
summary: When you get a cough from a cold, it's your body's way of fighting the virus. Cough medicines can't cure the cold, but they can make your throat feel better by coating it or reducing the tickle. Professor Jacky Smith says cheaper store-brand medicines work just as well as expensive ones. Be careful with sugar in syrupsâ€”sugar-free options are better. Honey and lemon are homemade remedies that can soothe your throat too. For chesty coughs with phlegm, some medicines claim to loosen it, but there's not strong proof. Always follow the dose on the label to stay safe.

background_read: Coughs are common in winter when cold viruses spread. They help clear your throat, but can be annoying. People use medicines or home remedies like honey and lemon to feel better. This article explains what works and what to be careful about, based on advice from a breathing expert.
Article_Structure: WHO: Professor Jacky Smith, a breathing doctor from the University of Manchester
WHAT: Compares cough medicines and honey/lemon for treating coughs
WHERE: In homes, offices, and public places during winter
WHY: To help people choose safe and effective ways to soothe coughs

perspectives.description: Professor Smith advises that cough medicines soothe symptoms but don't cure viruses, and cheaper options are just as good.
